poem:
### Builders and Bills

In the web of pipes,  
brick dreams float away  
on the surge of a rising bill.

Steel hearts
laid in the foundation  
of promises made—

water's climb,  
a ladder to new rooftops,  
saturates the unbuilt.

Labor in the current,  
balancing hope and the  
inevitable flood.
